events.description: Tiberius Julius Alexander orders his Roman legions in Alexandria to swear allegiance to Vespasian as Emperor.
events.html: • 69 – Tiberius Julius Alexander orders his Roman legions in Alexandria to swear allegiance to Vespasian as Emperor.[1]

events.description: Battle of Taginae: Byzantine forces under Narses defeat the Ostrogoths in Italy, and the Ostrogoth king, Totila, is mortally wounded.
events.html: • 552 – Battle of Taginae: Byzantine forces under Narses defeat the Ostrogoths in Italy, and the Ostrogoth king, Totila, is mortally wounded.[2]

events.description: Battle of Dorylaeum: Crusaders led by prince Bohemond of Taranto defeat a Seljuk army led by sultan Kilij Arslan I.
events.html: • 1097 – Battle of Dorylaeum: Crusaders led by prince Bohemond of Taranto defeat a Seljuk army led by sultan Kilij Arslan I.[3]

events.description: The Battle of La Higueruela takes place in Granada, leading to a modest advance of the Kingdom of Castile during the Reconquista.
events.html: • 1431 – The Battle of La Higueruela takes place in Granada, leading to a modest advance of the Kingdom of Castile during the Reconquista.[4]

events.description: Spanish conquistadors led by Hernán Cortés fight their way out of Tenochtitlan after nightfall.
events.html: • 1520 – Spanish conquistadors led by Hernán Cortés fight their way out of Tenochtitlan after nightfall.[5]

events.description: Jan van Essen and Hendrik Vos become the first Lutheran martyrs, burned at the stake by Roman Catholic authorities in Brussels.
events.html: • 1523 – Jan van Essen and Hendrik Vos become the first Lutheran martyrs, burned at the stake by Roman Catholic authorities in Brussels.[6]

entities.name: Jan van Essen and Hendrik Vos

events.description: Union of Lublin: The Kingdom of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania confirm a real union; the united country is called the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth or the Republic of Both Nations.
events.html: • 1569 – Union of Lublin: The Kingdom of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania confirm a real union; the united country is called the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth or the Republic of Both Nations.[7]

events.description: First meeting of the Westminster Assembly, a council of theologians ("divines") and members of the Parliament of England appointed to restructure the Church of England, at Westminster Abbey in London.
events.html: • 1643 – First meeting of the Westminster Assembly, a council of theologians ("divines") and members of the Parliament of England appointed to restructure the Church of England, at Westminster Abbey in London.

events.description: War of the Grand Alliance: Marshal de Luxembourg triumphs over an Anglo-Dutch army at the battle of Fleurus.
events.html: • 1690 – War of the Grand Alliance: Marshal de Luxembourg triumphs over an Anglo-Dutch army at the battle of Fleurus.[8]

entities.name: François-Henri de Montmorency, duc de Luxembourg

events.description: Glorious Revolution: Battle of the Boyne in Ireland (as reckoned under the Julian calendar).
events.html: • 1690 – Glorious Revolution: Battle of the Boyne in Ireland (as reckoned under the Julian calendar).

events.description: François-Jean de la Barre, a young French nobleman, is tortured and beheaded before his body is burnt on a pyre along with a copy of Voltaire's Dictionnaire philosophique nailed to his torso for the crime of not saluting a Roman Catholic religious procession in Abbeville, France.
events.html: • 1766 – François-Jean de la Barre, a young French nobleman, is tortured and beheaded before his body is burnt on a pyre along with a copy of Voltaire's Dictionnaire philosophique nailed to his torso for the crime of not saluting a Roman Catholic religious procession in Abbeville, France.

events.description: Lexell's Comet is seen closer to the Earth than any other comet in recorded history, approaching to a distance of 0.0146 astronomical units (2,180,000 km; 1,360,000 mi).
events.html: • 1770 – Lexell's Comet is seen closer to the Earth than any other comet in recorded history, approaching to a distance of 0.0146 astronomical units (2,180,000 km; 1,360,000 mi).

events.description: Raid on Lunenburg: American privateers attack the British settlement of Lunenburg, Nova Scotia.
events.html: • 1782 – Raid on Lunenburg: American privateers attack the British settlement of Lunenburg, Nova Scotia.

events.description: Johann Georg Tralles discovers the Great Comet of 1819, (C/1819 N1). It is the first comet analyzed using polarimetry, by François Arago.
events.html: • 1819 – Johann Georg Tralles discovers the Great Comet of 1819, (C/1819 N1). It is the first comet analyzed using polarimetry, by François Arago.

events.description: The five Central American nations of Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Costa Rica declare independence from the First Mexican Empire after being annexed the year prior.
events.html: • 1823 – The five Central American nations of Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Costa Rica declare independence from the First Mexican Empire after being annexed the year prior.[9]

events.description: A system of civil registration of births, marriages and deaths is established in England and Wales.
events.html: • 1837 – A system of civil registration of births, marriages and deaths is established in England and Wales.

events.description: Thomas Lempriere and James Clark Ross carve a marker on the Isle of the Dead in Van Diemen's Land to measure tidal variations, one of the earliest surviving benchmarks for sea level rise.
events.html: • 1841 – Thomas Lempriere and James Clark Ross carve a marker on the Isle of the Dead in Van Diemen's Land to measure tidal variations, one of the earliest surviving benchmarks for sea level rise.[10]

events.description: Signing of the Quinault Treaty: The Quinault and the Quileute cede their land to the United States.
events.html: • 1855 – Signing of the Quinault Treaty: The Quinault and the Quileute cede their land to the United States.

events.description: Joint reading of Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace's papers on evolution to the Linnean Society of London.
events.html: • 1858 – Joint reading of Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace's papers on evolution to the Linnean Society of London.

events.description: The Russian State Library is founded as the Library of the Moscow Public Museum.
events.html: • 1862 – The Russian State Library is founded as the Library of the Moscow Public Museum.

events.description: Princess Alice of the United Kingdom, second daughter of Queen Victoria, marries Prince Louis of Hesse, the future Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse.
events.html: • 1862 – Princess Alice of the United Kingdom, second daughter of Queen Victoria, marries Prince Louis of Hesse, the future Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse.

entities.name: Princess Alice of the United Kingdom
Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse

events.description: American Civil War: The Battle of Malvern Hill takes place. It is the last of the Seven Days Battles, part of George B. McClellan's Peninsula Campaign.
events.html: • 1862 – American Civil War: The Battle of Malvern Hill takes place. It is the last of the Seven Days Battles, part of George B. McClellan's Peninsula Campaign.

events.description: Slavery was abolished in the Dutch colony of Surinam, a date now celebrated as Ketikoti in independent Suriname.
events.html: • 1863 – Slavery was abolished in the Dutch colony of Surinam, a date now celebrated as Ketikoti in independent Suriname.

events.description: American Civil War: The Battle of Gettysburg begins.
events.html: • 1863 – American Civil War: The Battle of Gettysburg begins.[11]

events.description: The British North America Act takes effect as the Province of Canada, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia join into confederation to create the modern nation of Canada. John A. Macdonald is sworn in as the first Prime Minister of Canada. This date is commemorated annually in Canada as Canada Day, a national holiday.
events.html: • 1867 – The British North America Act takes effect as the Province of Canada, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia join into confederation to create the modern nation of Canada. John A. Macdonald is sworn in as the first Prime Minister of Canada. This date is commemorated annually in Canada as Canada Day, a national holiday.

events.description: The United States Department of Justice formally comes into existence.
events.html: • 1870 – The United States Department of Justice formally comes into existence.

events.description: Prince Edward Island joins into Canadian Confederation.
events.html: • 1873 – Prince Edward Island joins into Canadian Confederation.

events.description: The Sholes and Glidden typewriter, the first commercially successful typewriter, goes on sale.
events.html: • 1874 – The Sholes and Glidden typewriter, the first commercially successful typewriter, goes on sale.

events.description: Canada joins the Universal Postal Union.
events.html: • 1878 – Canada joins the Universal Postal Union.

events.description: Charles Taze Russell publishes the first edition of the religious magazine The Watchtower.
events.html: • 1879 – Charles Taze Russell publishes the first edition of the religious magazine The Watchtower.

events.description: The world's first international telephone call is made between St. Stephen, New Brunswick, Canada, and Calais, Maine, United States.
events.html: • 1881 – The world's first international telephone call is made between St. Stephen, New Brunswick, Canada, and Calais, Maine, United States.[12]

events.description: General Order 70, the culmination of the Cardwell and Childers reforms of the British Army, comes into effect.
events.html: • 1881 – General Order 70, the culmination of the Cardwell and Childers reforms of the British Army, comes into effect.

events.description: The United States terminates reciprocity and fishery agreement with Canada.
events.html: • 1885 – The United States terminates reciprocity and fishery agreement with Canada.

events.description: The Congo Free State is established by King Leopold II of Belgium.
events.html: • 1885 – The Congo Free State is established by King Leopold II of Belgium.[13]

events.description: Canada and Bermuda are linked by telegraph cable.
events.html: • 1890 – Canada and Bermuda are linked by telegraph cable.

events.description: Spanish–American War: The Battle of San Juan Hill is fought in Santiago de Cuba, Cuba.
events.html: • 1898 – Spanish–American War: The Battle of San Juan Hill is fought in Santiago de Cuba, Cuba.[14]

events.description: French government enacts its anti-clerical legislation Law of Association prohibiting the formation of new monastic orders without governmental approval.
events.html: • 1901 – French government enacts its anti-clerical legislation Law of Association prohibiting the formation of new monastic orders without governmental approval.[15]

events.description: Start of first Tour de France bicycle race.
events.html: • 1903 – Start of first Tour de France bicycle race.

events.description: SOS is adopted as the international distress signal.
events.html: • 1908 – SOS is adopted as the international distress signal.

events.description: Germany dispatches the gunship SMS Panther to Morocco, sparking the Agadir Crisis.
events.html: • 1911 – Germany dispatches the gunship SMS Panther to Morocco, sparking the Agadir Crisis.[16]

events.description: Leutnant Kurt Wintgens of the then-named German Deutsches Heer's Fliegertruppe army air service achieves the first known aerial victory with a synchronized machine-gun armed fighter plane, the Fokker M.5K/MG Eindecker.
events.html: • 1915 – Leutnant Kurt Wintgens of the then-named German Deutsches Heer's Fliegertruppe army air service achieves the first known aerial victory with a synchronized machine-gun armed fighter plane, the Fokker M.5K/MG Eindecker.

events.description: World War I: First day on the Somme: On the first day of the Battle of the Somme 19,000 soldiers of the British Army are killed and 40,000 wounded.
events.html: • 1916 – World War I: First day on the Somme: On the first day of the Battle of the Somme 19,000 soldiers of the British Army are killed and 40,000 wounded.

events.description: World War I: Russia launches an offensive against Austria-Hungary to capture Galicia, its final offensive of the war.
events.html: • 1917 – World War I: Russia launches an offensive against Austria-Hungary to capture Galicia, its final offensive of the war.[17]

events.description: Chinese General Zhang Xun seizes control of Beijing and restores the monarchy, installing Puyi, last emperor of the Qing dynasty, to the throne. The restoration is reversed just shy of two weeks later, when Republican troops regain control of the capital.
events.html: • 1917 – Chinese General Zhang Xun seizes control of Beijing and restores the monarchy, installing Puyi, last emperor of the Qing dynasty, to the throne. The restoration is reversed just shy of two weeks later, when Republican troops regain control of the capital.[18]

events.description: The Chinese Communist Party is founded by Chen Duxiu and Li Dazhao, with the help of the Far Eastern Bureau of the Russian Social Democratic Labour Party (Bolsheviks), who seized power in Russia after the 1917 October Revolution, and the Far Eastern Secretariat of the Communist International.
events.html: • 1921 – The Chinese Communist Party is founded by Chen Duxiu and Li Dazhao, with the help of the Far Eastern Bureau of the Russian Social Democratic Labour Party (Bolsheviks), who seized power in Russia after the 1917 October Revolution, and the Far Eastern Secretariat of the Communist International.

entities.name: Communist Party of the Soviet Union

events.description: The Great Railroad Strike of 1922 begins in the United States.
events.html: • 1922 – The Great Railroad Strike of 1922 begins in the United States.[19]

events.description: The Parliament of Canada suspends all Chinese immigration.
events.html: • 1923 – The Parliament of Canada suspends all Chinese immigration.

entities.name: History of Chinese immigration to Canada

events.description: The  National War Memorial for the Dominion of Newfoundland was inaugurated by Field Marshall Douglas Haig, 1st Earl Haig in St. John's, Newfoundland. The date commemorates the first day of the Battle of the Somme, where at  Beaumont-Hamel, 86 percent of the Royal Newfoundland Regiment was wiped out.
events.html: • 1924 – The National War Memorial for the Dominion of Newfoundland was inaugurated by Field Marshall Douglas Haig, 1st Earl Haig in St. John's, Newfoundland. The date commemorates the first day of the Battle of the Somme, where at Beaumont-Hamel, 86 percent of the Royal Newfoundland Regiment was wiped out.[20]

events.description: United Airlines begins service (as Boeing Air Transport).
events.html: • 1931 – United Airlines begins service (as Boeing Air Transport).

events.description: Wiley Post and Harold Gatty become the first people to circumnavigate the globe in a single-engined monoplane aircraft.
events.html: • 1931 – Wiley Post and Harold Gatty become the first people to circumnavigate the globe in a single-engined monoplane aircraft.

events.description: Australia's national broadcaster, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation, was formed.
events.html: • 1932 – Australia's national broadcaster, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation, was formed.

events.description: Regina, Saskatchewan, police and Royal Canadian Mounted Police ambush strikers participating in the On-to-Ottawa Trek.
events.html: • 1935 – Regina, Saskatchewan, police and Royal Canadian Mounted Police ambush strikers participating in the On-to-Ottawa Trek.

events.description: World War II: First Battle of El Alamein.
events.html: • 1942 – World War II: First Battle of El Alamein.

events.description: The Australian Federal Government becomes the sole collector of income tax in Australia as State Income Tax is abolished.
events.html: • 1942 – The Australian Federal Government becomes the sole collector of income tax in Australia as State Income Tax is abolished.

events.description: The City of Tokyo and the Prefecture of Tokyo are both replaced by the Tokyo Metropolis.
events.html: • 1943 – The City of Tokyo and the Prefecture of Tokyo are both replaced by the Tokyo Metropolis.

events.description: Crossroads Able is the first postwar nuclear weapon test.
events.html: • 1946 – Crossroads Able is the first postwar nuclear weapon test.[21]

events.description: The Philippine Air Force is established.
events.html: • 1947 – The Philippine Air Force is established.

events.description: Muhammad Ali Jinnah (Quaid-i-Azam) inaugurates Pakistan's central bank, the State Bank of Pakistan.
events.html: • 1948 – Muhammad Ali Jinnah (Quaid-i-Azam) inaugurates Pakistan's central bank, the State Bank of Pakistan.

events.description: The merger of two princely states of India, Cochin and Travancore, into the state of Thiru-Kochi (later re-organized as Kerala) in the Indian Union ends more than 1,000 years of princely rule by the Cochin royal family.
events.html: • 1949 – The merger of two princely states of India, Cochin and Travancore, into the state of Thiru-Kochi (later re-organized as Kerala) in the Indian Union ends more than 1,000 years of princely rule by the Cochin royal family.

events.description: The International Geophysical Year begins.
events.html: • 1957 – The International Geophysical Year begins.

events.description: The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation links television broadcasting across Canada via microwave.
events.html: • 1958 – The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation links television broadcasting across Canada via microwave.

events.description: Flooding of Canada's Saint Lawrence Seaway begins.
events.html: • 1958 – Flooding of Canada's Saint Lawrence Seaway begins.

events.description: Specific values for the international yard, avoirdupois pound and derived units (e.g. inch, mile and ounce) are adopted after agreement between the US, the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth countries.
events.html: • 1959 – Specific values for the international yard, avoirdupois pound and derived units (e.g. inch, mile and ounce) are adopted after agreement between the US, the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth countries.

events.description: The Trust Territory of Somaliland (the former Italian Somaliland) gains its independence from Italy. Concurrently, it unites as scheduled with the five-day-old State of Somaliland (the former British Somaliland) to form the Somali Republic.
events.html: • 1960 – The Trust Territory of Somaliland (the former Italian Somaliland) gains its independence from Italy. Concurrently, it unites as scheduled with the five-day-old State of Somaliland (the former British Somaliland) to form the Somali Republic.

events.description: Ghana becomes a republic and Kwame Nkrumah becomes its first President as Queen Elizabeth II ceases to be its head of state.
events.html: • 1960 – Ghana becomes a republic and Kwame Nkrumah becomes its first President as Queen Elizabeth II ceases to be its head of state.

events.description: Independence of Rwanda and Burundi.
events.html: • 1962 – Independence of Rwanda and Burundi.

events.description: ZIP codes are introduced for United States mail.
events.html: • 1963 – ZIP codes are introduced for United States mail.[22]

events.description: The British Government admits that former diplomat Kim Philby had worked as a Soviet agent.
events.html: • 1963 – The British Government admits that former diplomat Kim Philby had worked as a Soviet agent.

events.description: The first color television transmission in Canada takes place from Toronto.
events.html: • 1966 – The first color television transmission in Canada takes place from Toronto.

events.description: Merger Treaty: The European Community is formally created out of a merger between the Common Market, the European Coal and Steel Community, and the European Atomic Energy Commission.
events.html: • 1967 – Merger Treaty: The European Community is formally created out of a merger between the Common Market, the European Coal and Steel Community, and the European Atomic Energy Commission.

events.description: The United States Central Intelligence Agency's Phoenix Program is officially established.
events.html: • 1968 – The United States Central Intelligence Agency's Phoenix Program is officially established.

events.description: The Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is signed in Washington, D.C., London and Moscow by sixty-two countries.
events.html: • 1968 – The Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is signed in Washington, D.C., London and Moscow by sixty-two countries.

entities.name: Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

events.description: Formal separation of the United Auto Workers from the AFL–CIO in the United States.
events.html: • 1968 – Formal separation of the United Auto Workers from the AFL–CIO in the United States.

events.description: The first Gay pride march in England takes place.
events.html: • 1972 – The first Gay pride march in England takes place.

events.description: Portugal grants autonomy to Madeira.
events.html: • 1976 – Portugal grants autonomy to Madeira.

events.description: The Northern Territory in Australia is granted self-government.
events.html: • 1978 – The Northern Territory in Australia is granted self-government.

events.description: Sony introduces the Walkman.
events.html: • 1979 – Sony introduces the Walkman.

events.description: "O Canada" officially becomes the national anthem of Canada.
events.html: • 1980 – "O Canada" officially becomes the national anthem of Canada.

events.description: A North Korean Ilyushin Il-62M jet en route to Conakry Airport in Guinea crashes into the Fouta Djallon mountains in Guinea-Bissau, killing all 23 people on board.
events.html: • 1983 – A North Korean Ilyushin Il-62M jet en route to Conakry Airport in Guinea crashes into the Fouta Djallon mountains in Guinea-Bissau, killing all 23 people on board.

events.description: The Ministry of State Security is established as China's principal intelligence agency
events.html: • 1983 – The Ministry of State Security is established as China's principal intelligence agency[23]

events.description: The PG-13 rating is introduced by the MPAA.
events.html: • 1984 – The PG-13 rating is introduced by the MPAA.

events.description: The American radio station WFAN in New York City is launched as the world's first all-sports radio station.
events.html: • 1987 – The American radio station WFAN in New York City is launched as the world's first all-sports radio station.

events.description: German reunification: East Germany accepts the Deutsche Mark as its currency, thus uniting the economies of East and West Germany.
events.html: • 1990 – German reunification: East Germany accepts the Deutsche Mark as its currency, thus uniting the economies of East and West Germany.

events.description: Cold War: The Warsaw Pact is officially dissolved at a meeting in Prague.
events.html: • 1991 – Cold War: The Warsaw Pact is officially dissolved at a meeting in Prague.

events.description: The Finnish operator Radiolinja is launched as the world's first GSM network.
events.html: • 1991 – The Finnish operator Radiolinja is launched as the world's first GSM network.[24][25]

events.description: China resumes sovereignty over the city-state of Hong Kong, ending 156 years of British colonial rule.  The handover ceremony is attended by British Prime Minister Tony Blair, Charles, Prince of Wales, Chinese President Jiang Zemin and U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright.
events.html: • 1997 – China resumes sovereignty over the city-state of Hong Kong, ending 156 years of British colonial rule. The handover ceremony is attended by British Prime Minister Tony Blair, Charles, Prince of Wales, Chinese President Jiang Zemin and U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright.

entities.name: Charles III of the United Kingdom

events.description: Space Shuttle program: Space Shuttle Columbia is launched on STS-94, a re-flight of the prematurely-ended STS-83 mission with the same crew.
events.html: • 1997 – Space Shuttle program: Space Shuttle Columbia is launched on STS-94, a re-flight of the prematurely-ended STS-83 mission with the same crew.[26]

events.description: The Scottish Parliament is officially opened by Elizabeth II on the day that legislative powers are officially transferred from the old Scottish Office in London to the new devolved Scottish Executive in Edinburgh. In Wales, the powers of the Welsh Secretary are transferred to the National Assembly.
events.html: • 1999 – The Scottish Parliament is officially opened by Elizabeth II on the day that legislative powers are officially transferred from the old Scottish Office in London to the new devolved Scottish Executive in Edinburgh. In Wales, the powers of the Welsh Secretary are transferred to the National Assembly.

events.description: The International Criminal Court is established to prosecute individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and the crime of aggression.
events.html: • 2002 – The International Criminal Court is established to prosecute individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and the crime of aggression.

events.description: Bashkirian Airlines Flight 2937, a Tupolev Tu-154, and DHL Flight 611, a Boeing 757, collide in mid-air over Überlingen, southern Germany, killing all 71 on board both planes.
events.html: • 2002 – Bashkirian Airlines Flight 2937, a Tupolev Tu-154, and DHL Flight 611, a Boeing 757, collide in mid-air over Überlingen, southern Germany, killing all 71 on board both planes.

events.description: Over 500,000 people protest against efforts to pass anti-sedition legislation in Hong Kong.
events.html: • 2003 – Over 500,000 people protest against efforts to pass anti-sedition legislation in Hong Kong.

events.description: Saturn orbit insertion of Cassini–Huygens begins at 01:12 UTC and ends at 02:48 UTC.
events.html: • 2004 – Saturn orbit insertion of Cassini–Huygens begins at 01:12 UTC and ends at 02:48 UTC.

events.description: The first operation of Qinghai–Tibet Railway is conducted in China.
events.html: • 2006 – The first operation of Qinghai–Tibet Railway is conducted in China.

events.description: Smoking in England is banned in all public indoor spaces.
events.html: • 2007 – Smoking in England is banned in all public indoor spaces.

events.description: Riots erupt in Mongolia in response to allegations of fraud surrounding the 2008 legislative elections.
events.html: • 2008 – Riots erupt in Mongolia in response to allegations of fraud surrounding the 2008 legislative elections.[27]

events.description: Croatia becomes the 28th member of the European Union.
events.html: • 2013 – Croatia becomes the 28th member of the European Union.[28]

entities.name: Accession of Croatia to the European Union

events.description: The United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement replaces NAFTA.
events.html: • 2020 – The United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement replaces NAFTA.[29]

events.description: At the centennial ceremony of the Dominion of Newfoundland National War Memorial, the Commonwealth War Graves Commission allowed an unprecedented second Canadian Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. The Royal Newfoundland Regiment solder was entombed in the memorial at this ceremony.
events.html: • 2024 – At the centennial ceremony of the Dominion of Newfoundland National War Memorial, the Commonwealth War Graves Commission allowed an unprecedented second Canadian Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. The Royal Newfoundland Regiment solder was entombed in the memorial at this ceremony.[30]
